p: Nigella sativa seeds were purchased from a local herbal shop in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. The seeds (250 g) were cleaned, dried in a hot air oven, and mechanically grinded to obtain Nigella sativa powder (NSP). One hundred grams of NSP was extracted three times with 300 mL of 96% ethanol. The extracts were filtered, and the solvent was evaporated using a rotary, resulting in a blackish-brown liquid concentrate of NSE as expected (Hadjzadeh et al., 2012). NSE was emulsified in water and administered to rats using a stomach tube.
